author: GamingBolt
description: The Outer Worlds 2 still delivers the quirky setting of the first game. Combined with the overarching mystery of the rifts and the tug-of-war between ideologies, the sequel is promising a more engaging and high-stakes narrative filled with the deep role-playing systems fans crave.
title: Why The Outer Worlds 2 Is Shaping Up To Be One of The Biggest Games of the Year

author: GamingBolt
description:
Ninja Gaiden 4 sharpens its blades, dials up the combar, and weaves swiftness and verticality into every action - Team Ninja are unleashing a sequel aimed squarely at reclaiming its legacy following Ninja Gaiden 3’s mixed reception. 

As combat philosophies evolve with lethal precision and traversal mechanics expand with newfound style, the result - following a partnership between Team Ninja and PlatinumGames - is a modernised vision for the legendary series. 

It doesn’t erase Ninja Gaiden 3’s mistakes as much as answer them, restoring mechanical bones and visually arresting flesh to be dissected anew by the game’s dual protagonists. 

Ninja Gaiden 3 attempted accessibility, but Ninja Gaiden 4 counteracts successfully with depth that is both inviting and intimidating. Ultimately, this sequel is more recognisably Ninja Gaiden.
title: NINJA GAIDEN 4 vs NINJA GAIDEN 3  - 15 MASSIVE Changes You Might Not Be Aware of

author: GamingBolt
description:
Yooka-Replaylee, as promised, is the “definitive” version of Yooka-Laylee in almost every way. The presentation is a significant step up, and many of the more annoying aspects of the original are either downplayed or revamped. 

However, it’s still Yooka-Laylee at its core, which means dealing with uninspired platforming sequences, so-so bosses, unfunny dialogue and worlds that feel more cobbled together than anything else. That may appeal to a strong contingent who loved the original despite its flaws, and might make for a stronger sell to those previously wary, even if it’s far from an amazing platformer.
title: Yooka-Replaylee Review - Is This Really The "Definitive" Version of the 2017 Original?
